cab.content: (THIS DOCUMENT 18 TH3 PROPERTY 0? HIS BRIT AMI C MAJ^STY''S (KJV3RBEET).ASECRET,$ CABIN IT,C.P. 3210. .SUPPLY OJi WAR MATgijIAl; TO TK3 GREEKS*(Hotei byn the Acting Secretary, Cabinet)^The appended telegram from the Prime Minister is circulatedto the Cabinet cn the instructions of the Lord Privy Seal. Thenecessary administrative steps are being taken.(Sgd.) T. JOHSS,Acting Secretary, 2, "Whitehall Gardens, S.W. Cabinet.11th August, 1921. - .TELEGRAM. Decypher Lord Hardinge (Paris) 10th August, 1921*D. 9.30 p.m. 10th August, 1921. R. 9.25a.m. 11th August, 1921.ITo. 589.following from prime Minister for Mr. A. Chamberlain. Begins.Following resolution was taken by Supreme Council this morning in regard to supply of war material to Greeks: it 17as agreed to continue an attitude of strict neutrality in war between the Turks and Greeks, that is to say, the Governments agree not to intervene in the struggle with assistance of any kind, whether in form of troops) arms or credit, it being understood, that above suggestion in no way infringes rights of private firms to freedom of trade.Ends,Please take all administrative steps required to remove existing embargo on supply of war material to Greeks by private firms and arrange that leading armament firms may be informed of this.Ends.
